150298584.review:
If you're a fan of fireworks and you are looking for a simulation fireworks type of game, this game is 100% it.

By default you get a couple of different type of maps to play in, place down fireworks, light it up and enjoy it. Connect the fireworks by fuses with different delays. The default fireworks in the game might leave you wanting more. That is where modding comes in.

Plenty of mods will give you, community made fireworks based on ideas or copies of actual firework and adding a completly new type of firework with custom made functionalities like tubes and shells. You also get the option to install extra maps to play in. Community made tools that will help you create an awesome fireworks show, tools like remote control devices or saving and reloading shells setups.

The game is still in development with multiplayer beta coming soon(tm) by a developer keeping control over his game and the process of making his fireworks game, doing it his way while still taking community feedback and ideas. A community that is full of ideas and firework fans that is welcoming everyone new and help enjoy this game.

It's a lot of fun and it's going to be even better with multiplayer in the future.

140690902.review:
You'd be forgiven for thinking this is on a par with that pathetic Fireworks offering on the xbox live marketplace from back in the days of the xbox 360 and it really was poor. This is definitely _not that kind of game_.  This is on such a different level that this quite possibly, will be the only Fireworks game you should ever want, need or indeed have in your software collection. If you have money to burn, buy it. If you like fireworks - a lot - definitely buy it. If you feel the need for more games and something not in your usual favourite genre or style of game, buy it anyway. Don't like the idea of fireworks? Buy it anyway - because by the time you have spent about five or ten minutes playing this game, you will probably love the idea of fireworks. Obviously be mindful of the pets if you have any, and if your neighbour happens to be a veteran and has PTSD, don't be a twat with the volume.

Now, you can literally set a whole town to blaze in this game it's insane. Do be warned though. I did find that filling the church in the town map (conveniently called "Town") full of gas canisters and then dumping a load of fireworks called 'Tim' in there did achieve an almost nuclear result - my poor hamster-run laptop worked it's little nuts off trying to achieve the whiteout effect, and then when that died down, the petrol station blew up, the firework store blew up in all kinds of pretty colours and patterns, and the rest of the town was either in flames or ruined. Never had this much since I TNT'd my way down to the bottom of a Minecraft map - even if the initial blast was a bit of a headache on the system. Obviously the less capable your system is, the more you're going to need to do some tweaking, reducing resolution, reducing special effects like motion blur etc etc. But despite all that, and despite the fact it took my system and ragged it like a rottweiler with a teddy bear, it did actually still pull through and end up being very entertaining indeed. I cannot recommend this game highly enough.

TL/DR: Quite possibly a pyromaniac's wet dream.

Kudos to the dev.

130457717.review:
Amazing game with mods it's definitely worth more than the asking price.   The base game content was a little underwhelming in terms of number of fireworks and environments, however the work that was done to make it all work behind the scenes including all the programming and workshop integration are easily worth the asking price and when considering what the developer has opened up with the custom workshop it's easily a AAA price point.    Again I think it's under-priced but this is an example of how developers should do games like this - provide the tools and support in game for the community to come in and fill in the content with a reasonable asking price.

Great job on this - what an amazing accomplishment and absolutely fun game - I hope to see this have the success of Gary's Mod and the overwhelming reviews are TOTALLY justified.   Would love to be able to add music backtracks in the future !

Edit: Developer reached out to me and let me know there are mods already for playing background music.   Again AMAZING !!!!!!

Update to Review. I realised reading this through most people still wouldn't really know what the game was like. So the dev's have updated the game a lot since i first installed the game and now the mods auto update which is great as before we have to un sub and sub again to get the update on the mod. There are now modded maps which run for the most part really well as long as your pc your using isnt a potato, I have been experimenting  with some mods to do some pyro shows to music and the mods i have come across made this rather easy. 123789703.review:
I've only played it for twenty minutes, but I'm definitely keeping it. Great atmosphere (you can almost smell the smoke) and intuitive controls. The reverse Y axis option is greatly appreciated.

UPDATE (a few days later): I'm now pretty besotted with this, and bought a copy for a friend. There's a lot of care been taken to the crafting of this game - the sound, for example, is amazing. And if there's a more satisfying gaming experience than setting fire to the fireworks shop, I have yet to experience it. As others have suggested, a private room multiplayer option would be an ideal addition.

117479717.review:
REVIEW #29
Fireworks Mania
----------

Fireworks Mania is simply a sandbox title that lets you shoot off fireworks in a handful of different locales. There's a couple of unlockables as well as Steam Workshop support, but that's really all that there is to this "game".

Personally, I would find this rather boring if it wasn't for one feature: destructible buildings. Especially in the town location, there's a small handful of buildings that you can blow up if you set up your fireworks right, and there's something so morbidly satisfying about filling a gas station with sky rockets and explosives, then watching it be consumed by a bright, colorful explosion as the roof flies off of the building.

There's no goals or anything to Fireworks Mania, so as of right now, that's all there is to this title. However, the destructive aspects are enough for me to recommend this for anyone who feels like escaping a bad day by blowing things up with fireworks. Just keep in mind that this is all of the substance that Fireworks Mania has to offer.

108848680.review:
I remember in Rollercoaster Tycoon when I was in my early teens (I'm 29 now) I would always play with the fireworks displays. A couple months ago I remember searching for a firework simulator but wasn't able to find one.

So to say that I was surprised when I discovered this on steam is an understatement. 

I have played for an hour straight since booting it up and absolutely love it. 
IF you're into fireworks and enjoy making your own fireworks display, being able to save it as a blueprint etc then this is the game for you.

I wish this existed when I was in my early teens, but I am grateful the Dev created it for me, as an adult to enjoy - which I don't find many games that give me enjoyment these days.

Good work! It's a fun game, you can make it as easy to play as you want or as difficult as you want which is why I like it. Gives you the freedom with fuse sizes to either decide on a huge display with different fuses for different parts of the display etc or you can just stack em all up at the gas station and blow it to pieces.

108565172.review:
This Is My official reveiw of this game!

Basic gameplay:

if you buy this game bone stock, its not much to look at .very based on the fact that it can run on potato computer, but still ive been around fireworks mania videos for more than a month now and some peoples computers still cant run it without lag, maybe its because of bad latency idk

not very many objects to spawn in
for your 12 dollars that you spend you get 4 locations and 85 default spawning objects (including the hidden ones)
the four locations i found you can get at the unity asset store for a bit of money made by somebody else which is probably where all the money is going twords those assets

low poly game, this could work either way in my opinion if you have everything low poly then more ram go to the explosions which are also low poly it just fits in my opinion.

Modded Gameplay: in my opinion the reason this game is getting more popular is the fact that mods have come into this game, we have realistic mods from amnesty, weird and wonderful from myself, and jjblock who is a codesmith

from these mods you have broken out of the explosions simulator into a cardriving simulator and roleplay maps simulator as found out from videos i have discovered.

we also have making your own maps now so thats fun i guess.

in conclusion deff get this game for its mods, who knows, we might be able to get monster trucks in the game soon

107500546.review: This is my 1st review on steam! When it comes to this game it's the little things for me. This is a gem and I've been enjoying all the progress/updates. I've had this game for nearly a year, but have been playing it more recently. Discovered this game because of Jackspeticye and immediately bought it. It’s more than just blowing stuff up. There’s the enjoyable hunt for the Easter eggs and the blue question marks to unlock more fireworks. It can be a playground for creating art as well. I took the roof of a gas station that kind of looks like a fast food tray to use as a prop and then put the burger on top (in the city map). Silly little things like that are nice. I appreciate the fun updates for the 4th of July even though the dev doesn’t live in the U.S and an update for the new year 2022. Having mods in this game is so fun and it’s creating a unique community around the game. I created a profile on mod.io so I could upvote and compliment some of the mod creators. Great respect for this indie game and all that are involved! Please be patient with the progress considering the small team and it’s the dev’s hobby, not a full-time job. I’ve even had the pleasure of talking with the dev on socials. Follow them on Twitter, YouTube, and or join the Discord to get more involved with its development! It’s not every day I get to be involved in the progress of a game where I truly feel heard and my feedback is taken into consideration. I’ve been having a blast (hehe) streaming this on Twitch! This is a great go-to when I don’t know what else to play and want to chill. 10/10 highly recommend it. Thanks!

104761443.review:
This game faithfully recreates the experience of screwing around with fireworks in your garden, without the third degree burns and potential maiming. The map art style is all it needs to be, given most of the time you'll be looking at all the pretty fireworks in the sky rather than the level geometry. The number of fireworks you get in the standard version is not that huge, so I highly recommend using the workshop, which has new content added daily. 

There are some things I would like added to the game, like key remapping, quick tool select, a lakeside map, some smaller "close up" fireworks, the ability to choreograph a display and a co-op/party mode. I know it's a bit of an ask given the size of the dev team, so I understand if these things either take a long time to get added, or simply won't get added at all. Saying that, the devs should be proud of what they've done so far. There's more than enough going on already to keep me busy.

95071527.review:
Really cool experience that allows you to live out your fireworks power fantasy. You can determine the order, the amount, and longevity of all your set-ups. It's easy to use. You simply choose your fireworks of choice, place them where needed, and rotate them around if necessary, and then you used a connector to determine the organization of your fireworks. slow, medium, fast, and instant. There will be some trial and error to determine what does what, and how the end results will be, but it's a great time to be had. You can even goof around and cause damage to buildings and blow some entirely up. Great for singleplayer experiences, would love to see MP added down the road, and awesome for streaming. Just be wary, going crazy on certain explosives, particularly propane tanks, can cause your computer to be pushed beyond it's limits, but that's only if you place an absurd amount of explosives in one place. I do recommend stress testing before you start organizing your displays. See how many particles and explosions can be handled at once. Check out my video if you want some examples of what can happen in this game: 

https://youtu.be/NUCcvMRKXIg

GAME. of. the. YEAR!
Love this thing!  It's really not a "game", per se, more of an "experience" but will call it a "game" for purposes of this review.  If you're like me, you never get to go to fireworks on July 4 (if you're in America, that's our Independence Day).  

I'm in a totally left-brained job and a right-brained, well, brain.  This game is the best thing ever for me - I love creating different shows with different colors, etc.  I also turn on John Philip Sousa marches in the background on Spotify.  Makes it all "official" just like July 4 without the issues of drunk drivers and weird neighbors.  :)  

Please, developers, add a "save" function because after you link up all these things, it takes some time and would be so nice to be able to keep track of your "shows" for future, or if you have to cut your session short you can easily come back right where you left off.

Additionally, please add more firework kinds to the lineup.  It would be awesome to get expansion packs or some such thing.  I believe in paying for great work, and this is the best thing ever.  THANK YOU!!!!!!

88412271.review:
I usually go to a large organised fireworks show at least once every year, but covid has unfortunately put paid to that.  I wasn't expecting much when I bought this game, but it is surprisingly polished - especially considering that it appears to be entirely the creation of a single person.

It's essentially just a sandbox where you are given a large selection of rockets, barrages/cakes, firecrackers and noisemakers along with a fuse tool for linking and adjusting the speed of ignition. You can create surprisingly enjoyable displays in just a few minutes - which is lucky, because there is currently no save/load feature (although this is in the works) - and then sit back and smile... then If you feel like melting your GPU/CPU then you can always fill a swimming pool with thousands of fireworks and propane tanks and enjoy a multicoloured slideshow for 15 mins while praying your computer doesn't crash

The game is still just as much fun and now has a save/load system and blueprints, so Ive nominated it for a Steam Award.

87736621.review:
Where to start? 
Overall this game is great and worth the purchase!

So far the game has been excellent to play. The fireworks modeling is very well done and the overall mechanics and feel of the game is simple yet satisfying. Nothing is overly complicated, but just technical enough to make it really intuitive and daresay a little educational in ways. For example: The fusing tool in the game, mechanically simple and easy to use, yet you can easily make things even more refined and unique by selecting the different fuse times.
 
One of the many pros I like, is the fact that anybody at any level of PC gaming experience can play this game. Kids will love it and the Adults will surely agree.

I would put a game Cons list here but from my experience as an average consumer, there really is not that many huge issues right out of the box. Many small issues and bugs get fixed and patched with updates, and the online community is very active and always sending feedback, which for any new game is a plus!

Really happy with my purchase and I always look forward to what the newest updates will be. A lot of hard work and dedication went into creating this game and so far, its only getting better.

86075810.review:
Valoración 8.5/10 (Lo recomiendo)

PROS:
- Muy buenos sonidos en general.
- Varios mapas, lo que permite mas jugabilidad.
- Gráficos muy buenos. Y no necesitas un pc extremadamente bueno.
- Cada varias semanas meten cosas nuevas o arreglar bugs...
- Precio no muy caro.
- Tienen un Discord en el cual te ayudan con cualquier cosa y hasta te responde el creador del juego.
- Varios idiomas en la interfaz del juego.
- Ocupa muy poco espacio. (A mi me indica que me ocupa 500mb)

CONTRAS:
- No puedes guardar tus creaciones/partida (El creador esta trabajando en ello para conseguir que se pueda)
- No hay Fuentes/Volcanes
- Sin conexión a internet no podrias escuchar el audio, aunque si jugar

Y bueno, esta es mi opinión del juego. Espero que os haya gustado o aclarado si comprarlo. Se agradeceria un like a la reseña para que se posicione arriba y todos puedan saber antes de comprarselo.
